description.narrative: The pilot project will be based on the thematic needs assessment conducted in 2014. FCA?s global work on the right to livelihoods focuses on small-scale agriculture, including increasing resilience of communities to shocks and hazards which may affect thei r livelihoods. This focus is key in the oPT given the high levels of food insecurity, low economic opportunities, and the regular shocks (including conflict and natural disasters) which communities are subject to. Continued support to particularly vulnera ble groups who may rely on agriculture as a source of income and subsistence addresses a key need, including in relation to building community and household resilience. Based on the recommendations from the IOPT thematic needs assessment conducted, a pilot project will be implemented by a (local) Palestinian NGO, working on integrating rural development in Palestine through economic and social empowerment of cooperatives, individuals and marginalised groups. The partner will be selected and assessed in 4th quarter of 2014 and in early 2015.Objectives:Building the capacity of cooperative members and developing respective institutional frameworks,Providing infrastructure support needed for sustainable development within the immediate scope of the project,Rural Production Support.The planned outcome will be to establish a solid working relationship with a new Palestinian partner, in order to explore more innovative ways of working in oPT. Rights-holders /beneficiaries: Youth, especially young women, to be define d during project formulation with selected partner.
